intro: Ceropegia linearior, commonly known as the linear leaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, tuberous roots. The plant produces small, pale greenish-yellow flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Its leaves are linear and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Ceropegia linearior is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique foliage and ease of care.
